original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das @216b kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das @216b kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: went to where the Blessed One was. Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: Sitting to one side,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: the Blessed One, through talk consistent with the Dharma,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: encouraged, and delighted King Bimbisāra.

original: chos kyi gtam rnam grangs du mas yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: chos kyi gtam rnam grangs du mas yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: Through many different kinds of talks consistent with the Dharma,🔽he instructed, inspired,🔽encouraged, and delighted him.

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so //
translated: Having instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted him, he remained silent.

original: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying po stan las langs te /🔽bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying po stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: Then King Bimbisāra rose from his seat,🔽put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rgyal po'i khab 'di na skyed mos tshal ga ge mo zhig na sbrul gdug pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab 'di na skyed mos tshal ga ge mo zhig na sbrul gdug pa /
translated: in a certain park in Rājagṛha there is a poisonous snake,

original: sbrul nag po chen po chen po mig gdug pa zhig mchis te /
analyzed: sbrul nag po chen po chen po mig gdug pa zhig mchis te /
translated: a large black snake with poisonous eyes.

original: skye bo mang po brlag par bgyid lags na /
analyzed: skye bo mang po brlag par bgyid lags na /
translated: It is destroying many people.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du de gdul bar gsol /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du de gdul bar gsol / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: Blessed One, please tame it out of compassion.”🔽Then the Blessed One assented to King Bimbisāra by his silence.

original: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying po bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bar gnang bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying po bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bar gnang bar rig nas /
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by his silence,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te stan las langs nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te stan las langs nas song ngo //
translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, rose from his seat, and departed.

original: @217a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs dang chos gos gsol te /
analyzed: @217a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs dang chos gos gsol te /
translated: Then, after the Blessed One had passed the night, in the morning he put on his lower garment and Dharma robes,

original: lhung bzed bsnams nas skyed mos tshal ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed bsnams nas skyed mos tshal ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas /
translated: took his alms bowl, and went to the pleasure grove.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od zer gser gyi kha dog can nyi ma stong gi 'od las lhag pa dag bkye ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od zer gser gyi kha dog can nyi ma stong gi 'od las lhag pa dag bkye ste /
translated: The Blessed One emitted golden light rays that surpassed the light of a thousand suns.

original: de dag gis skyed mos tshal de dag thams cad snang bar byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis skyed mos tshal de dag thams cad snang bar byas so //
translated: They illuminated the entire pleasure grove.

original: bskal pa stong gi bar du yongs su bsgoms pa'i byams pa'i 'od zer dag kyang bkye ste /
analyzed: bskal pa stong gi bar du yongs su bsgoms pa'i byams pa'i 'od zer dag kyang bkye ste /
translated: He also emitted light rays of love that had been cultivated for a thousand eons.

original: de dag gis de'i lus la phog ma thag tu rab tu sim par gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis de'i lus la phog ma thag tu rab tu sim par gyur to //
translated: As soon as they touched his body, he felt relief.

original: de nas sbrul gdug pa des phan tshun du bltas te /
analyzed: de nas sbrul gdug pa des phan tshun du bltas te /
translated: Then the snake looked around.

original: su'i mthus bdag gi lus sim par gyur cig gu snyam pa dang / des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: su'i mthus bdag gi lus sim par gyur cig gu snyam pa dang / des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: He saw the Blessed Buddha, his body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
translated: embellished with the eighty minor marks,

original: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a fathom-wide halo,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
translated: with a radiance greater than a thousand suns,

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang ba mthong ngo //
translated: beautiful in every way, like a moving mountain of jewels.

original: mthong ma thag tu des bcom ldan 'das la dad pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu des bcom ldan 'das la dad pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: As soon as he saw him, he generated a faithful mind toward the Blessed One.

original: dad pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: Having generated a faithful mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: the Blessed One taught him the Dharma that was appropriate for him.

original: bzhin bzang khyod nyid kyis rdzas 'di bsgrubs pa des na khyod sbrul gdug par lhung bar byas so //
analyzed: bzhin bzang khyod nyid kyis rdzas 'di bsgrubs pa des na khyod sbrul gdug par lhung bar byas so //
translated: “Good man, because you yourself obtained this substance, you fell into the nāga realm.

original: da yang nga la dad pa'i sems bskyed @217b la gter 'di la yang sems ma chags par byos dang legs so //
analyzed: da yang nga la dad pa'i sems bskyed @217b la gter 'di la yang sems ma chags par byos dang legs so //
translated: “Now, if you generate faith in me, and do not have attachment to this treasure, that would be good.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang sems can dmyal bar skyes re /
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang sems can dmyal bar skyes re /
translated: After you die, you will be born in the hells.”

original: de nas gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis de tshe rabs dran par mdzad pa de'i tshe de dus so //
analyzed: de nas gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis de tshe rabs dran par mdzad pa de'i tshe de dus so //
translated: Then, when the Blessed One caused him to remember his previous lives, he remembered.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke a verse:

original: khyod ni dud 'gror skyes pa la //
analyzed: khyod ni dud 'gror skyes pa la //
translated: “You were born as an animal.

original: da ni nga yis ci byar med //
analyzed: da ni nga yis ci byar med //
translated: Now what can I do for you?

original: mi khom par ni skyes zin gyi //
analyzed: mi khom par ni skyes zin gyi //
translated: You have already been born in an unfavorable state.

original: don med dus pas ci la phan //
analyzed: don med dus pas ci la phan //
translated: What benefit is there in useless delay?

original: 'dir ni rgyal ba snying rje can //
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyal ba snying rje can //
translated: Here, the compassionate Victor

original: nga la dad pa'i sems bskyed la //
analyzed: nga la dad pa'i sems bskyed la //
translated: has generated faith in me.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas spangs na legs //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas spangs na legs //
translated: If you abandon the animal realm, it will be good.

original: 'on tang mtho ris 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on tang mtho ris 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: Then you will go to the higher realms.”

original: de nas re zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis sbrul de lhung bzed kyi nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis sbrul de lhung bzed kyi nang du bcug ste /
translated: Then, after a while, the Blessed One put the snake in his alms bowl

original: 'od ma'i tshal du bsnams so //
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal du bsnams so //
translated: and took it to Bamboo Grove.

original: de'i skabs su rgyal po dang / yul ma ga dha'i skye bo'i tshogs kyis sbrul gdug pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar btul ba thos so //
analyzed: de'i skabs su rgyal po dang / yul ma ga dha'i skye bo'i tshogs kyis sbrul gdug pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar btul ba thos so //
translated: At that time, the king and the people of Magadha heard how the Blessed One had subdued the poisonous snake.

original: de nas sbrul gdug pa de rang gi lus la smad de kha 'tshos nas /
analyzed: de nas sbrul gdug pa de rang gi lus la smad de kha 'tshos nas /
translated: Then the poisonous snake, having bowed his head to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur te /
translated: felt joy in his heart.

original: shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes so //
analyzed: shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes so //
translated: After he died, he was reborn in the excellent realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha'i bu'am / lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems rnam pa gsum skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i bu'am / lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems rnam pa gsum skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is natural that when a god or goddess is born, three thoughts arise in his or her mind:

original: gang nas shi 'phos /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos /
translated: where he or she died,

original: gang du skyes /
analyzed: gang du skyes /
translated: where he or she was reborn,

original: las gang gis skyes snyam mo //
analyzed: las gang gis skyes snyam mo //
translated: and by what action he or she was reborn there.

original: de nas sbrul gdug pa las shi 'phos pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes pa dang / @218a *//
analyzed: de nas sbrul gdug pa las shi 'phos pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes pa dang / @218a *//
translated: Then he saw that he had died as a poisonous snake, was reborn in the excellent realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur pa des mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur pa des mthong ngo //
translated: and that he had felt joy in his heart toward the Blessed One.

original: de nas sngon sbrul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas sngon sbrul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the god who had been the poisonous snake thought this:

original: bdag zhag lon nas gzod bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag zhag lon nas gzod bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin gyi /
translated: “It is not right for me to go to see the Blessed One only after a day has passed.

original: bdag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: I will go to see the Blessed One before a day has passed.”

original: de nas sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa /
analyzed: de nas sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa /
translated: Then the god who had been the poisonous snake, wearing earrings and necklaces,

original: lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
analyzed: lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
translated: his body adorned with bracelets and anklets,

original: nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i cod pan can /
translated: his head adorned with a crown of various jewels,

original: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri k'a la sogs pas byugs pa des de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man da ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
analyzed: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri k'a la sogs pas byugs pa des de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man da ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
translated: his body anointed with saffron, tamala leaves, spṛka, and so on, that night filled the folds of his robe with divine flowers—utpala, padma, kumuda, puṇḍarīka, and mandārava—

original: 'od ma'i chal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'od ma'i chal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
translated: The entire area around the Vṛkṣaḥ shrine was illuminated with a great light.

original: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
translated: They scattered flowers over the Blessed One

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa'i bzhi rtogs par 'gyur pa de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa'i bzhi rtogs par 'gyur pa de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One directly apprehended the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the god who had previously been a poisonous snake, and taught him the Dharma accordingly.

original: de thos nas sngon sbrul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po @218b nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
analyzed: de thos nas sngon sbrul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po @218b nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
translated: When he heard it, the god who had previously been a poisonous snake destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where he sat.

original: des bden pa mthong nas dga' ba'i tshig tu brjod pa /
analyzed: des bden pa mthong nas dga' ba'i tshig tu brjod pa /
translated: Having seen the truths, he exclaimed joyfully:🔽“I’ve seen the truth!

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi khrag dang / mchi ma'i rgya mtsho bskams pa dang / rus pa'i ri las bsgral ba dang / ngan song gi sgo rnams bcad pa dang / mtho ris dang / thar pa'i sgo rnams phye ba dang / bdag lha dang /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi khrag dang / mchi ma'i rgya mtsho bskams pa dang / rus pa'i ri las bsgral ba dang / ngan song gi sgo rnams bcad pa dang / mtho ris dang / thar pa'i sgo rnams phye ba dang / bdag lha dang /
translated: liberated me from the mountain of my bones, closed the doors to the lower realms, opened the doors to the higher realms and liberation, and placed me among the gods and humans.

original: mi rnams kyi nang du bzhag pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du bzhag pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: No one has done this for me, not even my father,

original: mas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: mas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even my mother,

original: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even the king,

original: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even the gods,

original: nang mi dang / gnyen gyi tshogs kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: nang mi dang / gnyen gyi tshogs kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even my family and friends,

original: sngon gyi mtshun rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshun rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even my ancestors,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis lags so //
translated: not even the ascetics and brahmins.”

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: He continued:

original: nyes pa mang por ldan pa'i ngan song lam //
analyzed: nyes pa mang por ldan pa'i ngan song lam //
translated: “The path to the lower realms, with its many faults,

original: shin tu mi bzad khyod kyi mthu yis bcad //
analyzed: shin tu mi bzad khyod kyi mthu yis bcad //
translated: has been blocked by your power.

original: bsod nams rab ldan mtho ris 'gro ba phye //
analyzed: bsod nams rab ldan mtho ris 'gro ba phye //
translated: The path to the higher realms, with its great merit, has been opened.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i lam yang bdag gis thob //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i lam yang bdag gis thob //
translated: I have attained the path to nirvāṇa.

original: bdag gis de ring nyes pa spangs pa'i mig /
analyzed: bdag gis de ring nyes pa spangs pa'i mig /
translated: “Today I have obtained the eye that is free from faults,🔽Which is extremely pure and is based on you.

original: shin tu rnam dag khyod las brten nas thob; ;bdag ni sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha rol brgal //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag khyod las brten nas thob; ;bdag ni sdug bsngal rgya mtsho pha rol brgal //
translated: I have crossed the ocean of suffering,

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i zhi ba'i go 'phang thob //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i zhi ba'i go 'phang thob //
translated: And I have attained the state of peace that delights the noble ones.

original: mi mchog dbang po mi dang lhas mchod pa //
analyzed: mi mchog dbang po mi dang lhas mchod pa //
translated: “You are the supreme human, the lord, worshipped by humans and gods,

original: skye dang rga dang 'chi ba'i nad spangs pa //
analyzed: skye dang rga dang 'chi ba'i nad spangs pa //
translated: Free from the sicknesses of birth, aging, and death.

original: srid pa stong du mthong pa dka' ba yi //
analyzed: srid pa stong du mthong pa dka' ba yi //
translated: In a thousand existences it is difficult to see

original: thub pa khyod ni deng mthong 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: thub pa khyod ni deng mthong 'bras bu yod //
translated: The Sage, but today I have seen him and my life has meaning.🔽”

original: de nas do shal 'phyang ba dgar gyur te //
analyzed: de nas do shal 'phyang ba dgar gyur te //
translated: Then, with a hanging garland,

original: btud cing zhabs gnyis la ni phyag 'tshal nas //🔽dgra thub la ni @219a *//
analyzed: btud cing zhabs gnyis la ni phyag 'tshal nas // dgra thub la ni @219a *//
translated: He bowed down and touched his two feet to his head,🔽Circumambulated the Victor

original: bskor ba byas nas kyang //
analyzed: bskor ba byas nas kyang //
translated: Three times,🔽And then went to the god realm,

original: lha yi 'jig rten kha ltas lha yul song //
analyzed: lha yi 'jig rten kha ltas lha yul song //
translated: Looking up to the world of the gods.

original: de nas sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu de tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa dang / zhing pa 'bru rgyal bar gyur pa dang / dpa' po g-yul las rgyal ba dang / nad pa nad thams cad las thar ba bzhin du 'byor pa gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du 'ongs pa'i 'byor pa de nyid kyis de nyid kyi mtshan mo rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i thad du song nas /
analyzed: de nas sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bu de tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa dang / zhing pa 'bru rgyal bar gyur pa dang / dpa' po g-yul las rgyal ba dang / nad pa nad thams cad las thar ba bzhin du 'byor pa gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du 'ongs pa'i 'byor pa de nyid kyis de nyid kyi mtshan mo rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i thad du song nas /
translated: Then the son of the god who had been a demon in a previous life, like a merchant who has made a profit, like a farmer who has had an abundant harvest, like a hero who has won a battle, like a patient who has been cured of every disease, with the very same fortune with which he had come into the presence of the Blessed One, that very night he went into the presence of King Bimbisāra.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas te /

analyzed: rgyal po bslang nas 'di skad ces smras so; ;rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great King,

analyzed: longs / nyal te ci bya /
translated: get up! What are you doing sleeping?

analyzed: de nas rgyal po sad de 'od chen po dang / lha'i bu de mthong ngo //
translated: ” Then the king woke up and saw the great light and the son of the god.

analyzed: mthong nas kyang dga' zhing mgu ste khyod su zhig ces dris so //

original: de na re /
analyzed: de na re /
translated: He said,🔽“Great King,

analyzed: bdag ni skyed mos tshal der bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul gdug pa btul te shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes pa yin te /

original: bcom ldan 'das la'ang bdag gis bsnyen bkur byas nas bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la'ang bdag gis bsnyen bkur byas nas bden pa mthong bar gyur to //

original: da bdag gis khyod la bstan gyis khyod song la /
analyzed: da bdag gis khyod la bstan gyis khyod song la /
translated: Now I will show you. You go

analyzed: skyed mos tshal de'i phyogs ga ge mo zhig nas gter chen po phyung la /
translated: and dig up a great treasure from a certain place in that pleasure grove.

analyzed: bdag gi phyir bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bshos gsol te /

analyzed: yon gyi rabs kyang gdon par gsol cig / de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos lha'i @219b bu la cang mi zer bar khas blangs so //
translated: and recite the verses of giving.🔽” King Bimbisāra accepted the god’s request without saying a word.

original: de nas sngon sbrul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bus rgyal pos cang mi zer bas khas blangs par rig nas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sngon sbrul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bus rgyal pos cang mi zer bas khas blangs par rig nas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Then the god who had been the poisonous snake, knowing that the king had accepted his request without saying a word, disappeared on the spot.

original: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos de nyid kyi mtshan mo yul ma ga dha'i pho brang 'khor gyi mi dang / yul mi rnams la bsgo nas skyed mos tshal der song ste gter byung nas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba gsum gyi bar du bshos gsol te bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos de nyid kyi mtshan mo yul ma ga dha'i pho brang 'khor gyi mi dang / yul mi rnams la bsgo nas skyed mos tshal der song ste gter byung nas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zla ba gsum gyi bar du bshos gsol te bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: Then, on that very night, King Bimbisāra informed the people of the city of Magadha and the people of the country. He went to the park, found the treasure, and for three months provided food for the Blessed One and the community of monks. He asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bus las gang dag bgyis na des sprul gdug par skyes lags /
analyzed: sngon sprul gdug par gyur pa'i lha'i bus las gang dag bgyis na des sprul gdug par skyes lags /

original: las gang dag bgyis na des lha'i nang du skyes nas bden pa mthong bar gyur lags /
analyzed: las gang dag bgyis na des lha'i nang du skyes nas bden pa mthong bar gyur lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de shas cher chags pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de shas cher chags pa bskyed de /

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / sdug cing phongs pa dang / bkren pa rnams la sdang ba'i sems bskyed pa des ni sprul gdug par skyes so //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / sdug cing phongs pa dang / bkren pa rnams la sdang ba'i sems bskyed pa des ni sprul gdug par skyes so //
translated: and he generated a hostile mind toward ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, and the needy. Because of that, he was born as a poisonous snake.

original: nga la sems dga' bar byas pa des ni lha'i nang du skyes so //
analyzed: nga la sems dga' bar byas pa des ni lha'i nang du skyes so //
translated: By the joy he felt, he was reborn among the gods.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi ring la dge bsnyen du gyur to /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi ring la dge bsnyen du gyur to /
translated: During the time of the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Kāśyapa, he became a lay devotee.

original: skyabs su song ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi blangs pa des ni bden pa mthong par gyur to //
analyzed: skyabs su song ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi blangs pa des ni bden pa mthong par gyur to //
translated: By going for refuge and taking the precepts, he saw the truth.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: de bas na ser sna spang ba'i phyir brtson par bya ste /🔽ci nas sprul gdug par gyur pa'i nyes pa de lta bu dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de nyid lha'i bur gyur @220a *//
analyzed: de bas na ser sna spang ba'i phyir brtson par bya ste / ci nas sprul gdug par gyur pa'i nyes pa de lta bu dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de nyid lha'i bur gyur @220a *//
translated: therefore, you should strive to abandon stinginess.

original: pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs de dag lta bur 'gyur bar rgyal po khyod kyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs de dag lta bur 'gyur bar rgyal po khyod kyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: In whatever way, the faults of becoming a poisonous snake do not arise, and in that very way, you should train, O King, in order to obtain the mass of good qualities of becoming a son of the gods.

original: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod de rjes su yi rangs nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod de rjes su yi rangs nas /
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, having praised and rejoiced in the Blessed One’s words,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te stan las langs nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te stan las langs nas song ngo //
translated: bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, rose from his seat, and departed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One having said that,

original: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
analyzed: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
translated: those monks were delighted and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: zla ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang /🔽gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /
analyzed: zla ba zhes bya ba ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /
translated: The Moon🔽The Blessed Buddha was honored, revered, respected, and worshiped by kings, royal ministers, wealthy people, city-dwellers, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas,

original: bla mar byas /🔽ri mor byas /🔽mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: bla mar byas /🔽ri mor byas /🔽mchod pa byas te /
translated: yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, and mahoragas.

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: who had great merit,

analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
translated: who had obtained robes, alms-food, bedding, cushions, and medicines for the sick,

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas @220b pa mnyan du yod pa na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas @220b pa mnyan du yod pa na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, together with the community of monks and the community of nuns.

analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na bram ze zhing pa zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, there lived a certain brahman farmer. He took a wife from a family of equal rank,

analyzed: de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las chung ma la bu chags nas /

original: de zla ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: de zla ba brgyad dam /

analyzed: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /

analyzed: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa skye bo thams cad kyi mig sim par byed pa zhig btsas so //

analyzed: de yang bram ze des dka' bas rnyes pa yin te /

analyzed: de la bu dang / bu mo gzhan yang med nas de bskyed bsrings te phyir skyes nas /

analyzed: de 'jig rten thams cad sim par byed pa'i phyir bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis khye'u de'i ming zla ba zhes btags so //
translated: When the child grew up, because he captivated the entire world, the brahmins and householders named the child Candra.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'u zla ba grong khyer thams cad du brgyud de bskor bas bram ze de'ang khye'u de la lhag par byams par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u zla ba grong khyer thams cad du brgyud de bskor bas bram ze de'ang khye'u de la lhag par byams par gyur te /

analyzed: 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag gi tshe'ang rtag tu legs par bsrung ba lhur byed cing 'dug go /

analyzed: bram ze de'i khyim yang khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin dang nye ba zhig na 'dug go /

original: des bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pa rnyed do //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pa rnyed do //
translated: He found faith in the doctrine of the Blessed One.

analyzed: de yang tshe thung ste shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes @221a *// so; ;lha'i bu'am /

analyzed: lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems rnam gsum skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Soon after the birth of a god or goddess, three thoughts arise naturally:

original: gang nas shi 'phos /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos /
translated: “Where did I die?”

original: gang du skyes /
analyzed: gang du skyes /
translated: “Where was I reborn?”

original: las gang gis skyes snyam mo //
analyzed: las gang gis skyes snyam mo //
translated: “Because of what action was I reborn here?”

translated: Then he saw that he had died as a human, was reborn in the excellent Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and that he had been reborn there because of his faith in the Blessed One.

original: de nas sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: bdag zhag lon nas gzod bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin gyi /
translated: “It is not right for me to go to see the Blessed One only after a day has passed.

original: bdag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: I will go to see the Blessed One before a day has passed.”

original: de nas sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa /🔽lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
analyzed: de nas sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa / lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
translated: Then the god who had been the brahmin, wearing earrings and necklaces,🔽his body adorned with bracelets and anklets,

original: nor bu sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nor bu sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i cod pan can /
translated: his head adorned with a crown jewel,

original: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa des de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mud dang / padma dkar po dang / man da ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
analyzed: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa des de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mud dang / padma dkar po dang / man da ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /

analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
translated: and, illuminating the entire Jetavana with a great light,

original: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
translated: He scattered flowers over the Blessed One and

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / @221b khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / @221b khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the god who had been the brahmin,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /

analyzed: de thos nas sngon bram zer gyur pa'i lha'i bus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
translated: Having heard it, the god who had been the brahmin destroyed with the vajra of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where he sat.

original: des bden pa mthong nas dga' ba'i tshig lan gsum du brjod de /
analyzed: des bden pa mthong nas dga' ba'i tshig lan gsum du brjod de /
translated: Having seen the truths, he uttered these joyful verses three times:🔽“I pay homage to the Buddha,

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi khrag dang / mchi ma'i rgya mtsho bskams pa dang / rus pa'i ri las bsgral ba dang / ngan song gi sgo rnams bcad pa dang / mtho ris dang / thar pa'i sgo rnams phye ba dang / bdag lha dang /
translated: liberated me from the mountain of my bones, closed the doors to the lower realms, opened the doors to the higher realms and liberation, and placed me among the gods and humans.

analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du bzhag pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: No one has done this for me, not even my father,

original: mas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: mas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even my mother,

original: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even the king,

original: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even the gods,

original: nang mi dang / gnyen gyi tshogs kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: nang mi dang / gnyen gyi tshogs kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even my family and friends,

original: sngon gyi mtshun rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshun rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not even my ancestors,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis lags so //
translated: not even the ascetics and brahmins.”

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: He continued:

original: nyes pa mang por ldan pa'i ngan song lam //
analyzed: nyes pa mang por ldan pa'i ngan song lam //
translated: “The path to the lower realms, with its many faults,

original: shin tu mi bzang khyod kyi mthu yis bcad //
analyzed: shin tu mi bzang khyod kyi mthu yis bcad //
translated: has been blocked by your power.

original: bsod nams rab ldan mtho ris 'gro ba phye //

translated: Then he saw that he had died as an animal and was reborn in the excellent god realm of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and that he had developed a mind of faith in the Blessed One.

original: de nas sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the god who had previously been the buffalo thought,

original: bdag zhag lon nas gzod bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin gyi bdag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag zhag lon nas gzod bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin gyi bdag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: “It is not right for me to wait a day before going to see the Blessed One. I will go to see the Blessed One right away.”

original: de nas sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa; lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
analyzed: de nas sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa; lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
translated: Then the god who had previously been the buffalo, wearing earrings and necklaces,🔽adorned with bracelets and anklets,

original: nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i cod pan can /
translated: with a crown jewel,

original: lus gur kum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa des de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
analyzed: lus gur kum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa des de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
translated: He anointed his body with saffron, tamala leaves, and spṛka, and that night he filled the front of his shirt with divine flowers—utpala, padma, kumuda, puṇḍarīka, and mandārava—

original: nags khrod de dag thams cad 'od chen @247b pos snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: nags khrod de dag thams cad 'od chen @247b pos snang bar byas nas /
translated: and he illuminated the entire forest with a great light.

original: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: He scattered the flowers over the Bhagavān and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the god who had been the buffalo, taught the Dharma that was appropriate for him and that caused him to penetrate the four truths of the noble ones.

original: de thos nas sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthong po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
analyzed: de thos nas sngon ma her gyur pa'i lha'i bus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthong po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
translated: When he heard this, the god who had previously been a buffalo destroyed with the vajra of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: He then attained the result of stream entry.

original: des bden pa mthong nas dga' ba'i tshig lan gsum du brjod de /
analyzed: des bden pa mthong nas dga' ba'i tshig lan gsum du brjod de /
translated: Having seen the truths, he spoke these delighted exclamations three times:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi khrag dang / mchi ma'i rgya mtsho bskams pa dang / rus pa'i la bsgral ba dang / ngan song gi sgo rnams bcad pa dang / mtho ris dang / thar pa'i sgo rnams phye ba dang / bdag lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du bzhag pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi khrag dang / mchi ma'i rgya mtsho bskams pa dang / rus pa'i la bsgral ba dang / ngan song gi sgo rnams bcad pa dang / mtho ris dang / thar pa'i sgo rnams phye ba dang / bdag lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du bzhag pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: “Lord, Blessed One, you have dried up the ocean of my blood and tears, delivered me from the swamp of bones, closed the doors to the lower realms, opened the doors to the higher realms and liberation, and placed me among the gods and humans. No one has done this for me—

original: mas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: mas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not my father,🔽not my mother,

original: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not the king,

original: lha rnams kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: lha rnams kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not the gods,

original: nang mi dang gnyen gyi tshogs rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: nang mi dang gnyen gyi tshogs rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not my relatives,

original: sngon gyi mtshun rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshun rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not my ancestors.

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis lags so //
translated: Nor have the ascetics and the brahmins done so.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: He then said:

original: nyes pa mang por ldan pa'i ngan song lam //
analyzed: nyes pa mang por ldan pa'i ngan song lam //
translated: “The path to the lower realms, with its many faults,

original: shin tu mi bzad khyod kyi mthu yis bcad //
analyzed: shin tu mi bzad khyod kyi mthu yis bcad //
translated: has been blocked by your power.

original: bsod nams rab ldan mtho ris 'gro ba phye //
analyzed: bsod nams rab ldan mtho ris 'gro ba phye //
translated: The path to the higher realms, with its great merits, has been opened.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i lam yang bdag gis thob //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i lam yang bdag gis thob //
translated: I have also attained the path to nirvāṇa.

original: bdag @248a *// gis de ring nyes pa spangs pa'i mig /
analyzed: bdag @248a *// gis de ring nyes pa spangs pa'i mig /
translated: Today, I have obtained the eye that is free from faults

original: shin tu rnam dag khyod la brten nas thob //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag khyod la brten nas thob //
translated: and is very pure, relying on you.

original: bdag ni sdug bsngal rgya mtsho'i pha rol brgal //
analyzed: bdag ni sdug bsngal rgya mtsho'i pha rol brgal //
translated: I have crossed the ocean of suffering

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i zhi ba'i go 'phang thob //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i zhi ba'i go 'phang thob //
translated: and attained the state of peace that delights the noble ones.

original: mi mchog dbang po mi dang lhas mchod pa //
analyzed: mi mchog dbang po mi dang lhas mchod pa //
translated: O lord of humans, worshipped by humans and gods,

original: skye dang rga dang 'chi ba'i nad spangs pa //
analyzed: skye dang rga dang 'chi ba'i nad spangs pa //
translated: free from the sicknesses of birth, aging, and death,

original: srid pa stong du mthong bar dka' ba yi //
analyzed: srid pa stong du mthong bar dka' ba yi //
translated: it is difficult to see you in a thousand existences.

original: thub pa khyod ni de mthong 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: thub pa khyod ni de mthong 'bras bu yod //
translated: O sage, it is worthwhile to see you.

original: de nas do shal 'phyang ba dag 'gyur te //
analyzed: de nas do shal 'phyang ba dag 'gyur te //
translated: ” Then, with hanging garlands,

original: btud cing zhabs gnyis la ni phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: btud cing zhabs gnyis la ni phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: bowing down and prostrating at his two feet,🔽he said this:

original: dgra thub la ni bskor ba byas nas kyang //
analyzed: dgra thub la ni bskor ba byas nas kyang //
translated: And circumambulated the Victorious One.

original: lha yi 'jig rten kha bltas lha yul song //
analyzed: lha yi 'jig rten kha bltas lha yul song //
translated: Then, facing the celestial realm, he departed for the god realm.

original: de nas sngon gnyer  gyur pa'i lha'i bu de tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa dang / zhing pa 'bru rgyal bar gyur pa dang / dpa' bo g-yul las rgyal ba dang / nad pa nad thams cad las thar ba bzhin du 'byor pa gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du 'ongs pa'i 'byor ba de nyid kyis rang gi gnas su song ngo //
analyzed: de nas sngon gnyer  gyur pa'i lha'i bu de tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa dang / zhing pa 'bru rgyal bar gyur pa dang / dpa' bo g-yul las rgyal ba dang / nad pa nad thams cad las thar ba bzhin du 'byor pa gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du 'ongs pa'i 'byor ba de nyid kyis rang gi gnas su song ngo //
translated: Then, just like a merchant who has made a profit, a farmer who has had a good harvest, a hero who has won a battle, or a sick person who has been cured of all disease, the god who had been the bull herder in a past life returned to his own realm in the same way he had come to the Blessed One.

original: de nas ma he rdzi de dag gis snang ba chen po de mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas ma he rdzi de dag gis snang ba chen po de mthong ngo //
translated: Then the bull herders saw a great light.

original: de mthong nas the tshom skyes te /
analyzed: de mthong nas the tshom skyes te /
translated: Seeing it, they were filled with doubt.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: So they asked the Blessed Buddha, the one who cuts through all doubts,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mdang sum bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du mchis te /
analyzed: mdang sum bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du mchis te /
translated: last night a god came before the Blessed One.

original: lha'i 'od kyis snang bar bgyid pa de su zhig lags /
analyzed: lha'i 'od kyis snang bar bgyid pa de su zhig lags /
translated: Who was the god whose divine light illuminated the place?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Bull herders,

original: khyed kyi ma he de nga la sems dga' bar gyur te /🔽shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes te /
analyzed: khyed kyi ma he de nga la sems dga' bar gyur te / shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes te /
translated: Your buffalo was pleased with me,

original: de mdang sum nga'i thad @248b du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de mdang sum nga'i thad @248b du 'ongs nas /
translated: and after he died he was reborn in the good place of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.🔽Last night he came to me,

original: ngas de la chos bstan te /
analyzed: ngas de la chos bstan te /
translated: and I taught him the Dharma.

original: bden pa mthong bar gyur nas rang gi gnas su song ngo //
analyzed: bden pa mthong bar gyur nas rang gi gnas su song ngo //
translated: After he saw the truths, he went to his own place.

original: de nas ma he rdzi de dag mchog tu ya mtshan du gyur te ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: de nas ma he rdzi de dag mchog tu ya mtshan du gyur te ngo mtshar to //
translated: ” Then the buffalo herders were amazed and said, “How amazing!

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa 'di'ang dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das dang phrad nas lha'i nang du skyes te /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa 'di'ang dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das dang phrad nas lha'i nang du skyes te /
translated: Even one born in the animal realm, after meeting the Dharma teacher, the Blessed One, was reborn among the gods

original: bden pa mthong bar gyur na bdag cag gis ci ste khyad par thob par mi 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: bden pa mthong bar gyur na bdag cag gis ci ste khyad par thob par mi 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: and saw the truths. Why shouldn’t we obtain a special attainment?”

original: de nas de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zhal zas bzang pos tshom par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa zhal zas bzang pos tshom par byas nas /
translated: Then they satisfied the Blessed Buddha and the community of monks with good food,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du rab tu byung ste /
translated: and went forth in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: de dag gis brtson pa pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis brtson pa pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Through their diligence, practice, and effort, they abandoned all defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.

original: de nas dge slong dag the tshoms kyes te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong dag the tshoms kyes te /
translated: Then the monks, feeling doubtful,

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: asked the Blessed Buddha, the Vanquisher of Doubts,

original: btsun pa / sngon ma he ra gyur pa'i lha'i bus gang dag bgyis na des ma her skyes lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / sngon ma he ra gyur pa'i lha'i bus gang dag bgyis na des ma her skyes lags /
translated: “O Honored One, what did the god who was formerly a buffalo do that he was reborn as a buffalo?

original: las gang dag bgyis na des lha'i nang du skyes te bden pa mthong bar gyur lags /
analyzed: las gang dag bgyis na des lha'i nang du skyes te bden pa mthong bar gyur lags /
translated: What did he do that he was reborn among the gods and saw the truth?

original: ma he rdzi rnams kyis ni las ci bgyis na de sa ma he rdzir gyur lags /
analyzed: ma he rdzi rnams kyis ni las ci bgyis na de sa ma he rdzir gyur lags /
translated: What did the buffalo herders do that they became buffalo herders?

original: las gang bgyis pas ni rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
analyzed: las gang bgyis pas ni rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
translated: What did they do that they went forth, and actualized the state of an arhat?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks!

original: 'di dag nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhag dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhag dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
translated: They themselves, in their previous lives, have gathered the accumulations and have the conditions for their fruition.

original: dba' rgal bzhin du byung la gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i @249a *//
analyzed: dba' rgal bzhin du byung la gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i @249a *//
translated: Like a flood, they will definitely come.

original: las de dag byas shing bsags pas na /
analyzed: las de dag byas shing bsags pas na /
translated: They themselves have created and accumulated those actions.

original: de dag nyid kyi las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Who else will experience those actions that they themselves have created and accumulated?

original: dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
translated: Monks, actions that have been created and accumulated do not ripen upon the external earth element.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not ripen upon the water element, the fire element, or the wind element.

original: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that have been created and accumulated ripen upon the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated.

original: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assembly and time are right,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: the fruit will ripen.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye dgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye dgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na / de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: “Monks, in the past, in this fortunate eon, when people lived as long as twenty thousand years,🔽there appeared in the world a teacher named Kāśyapa,🔽a blessed buddha,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: a thus-gone,🔽a worthy one,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: a perfect buddha,

original: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: one with perfect knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a well-gone one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu gdul bya'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu gdul bya'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a guide who tames people,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: an unsurpassed being,

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: a blessed buddha.

original: de grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags na rten cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: de grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags na rten cing bzhugs so //
translated: He lived and dwelt in the Deer Park in Vārāṇasī, the place of the sages.

original: de'i tshe dge slong dag gtan la 'bebs par byed pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dag gtan la 'bebs par byed pa na /
translated: At that time, when the monks were settling the scriptures,

analyzed: dge slong sde snod gsum pa zhig 'khor lnga brgya dang @249b gtan la 'bebs pa'i nang na 'dug go /
translated: There was a tripiṭaka master among the monks who was sitting in the midst of a retinue of five hundred.

original: de'i nang na slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dge slong dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: de'i nang na slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dge slong dag kyang yod de /
translated: Among them were monks who were training and those who were beyond training.

analyzed: de dag sde snod gsum pa la 'dri bar byed la /
translated: They asked questions of the tripiṭaka master,🔽but he was unable to answer them.

analyzed: des ni lan ma thebs pa dang / de khros nas ngag gi las rtsub po phyung ste /
translated: In anger he said,

original: nags kyi ma he dang 'dra ba 'di dag ci shes zhes byas /
analyzed: nags kyi ma he dang 'dra ba 'di dag ci shes zhes byas /
translated: “What do these people who are like wild buffaloes know?”🔽His students also said,

analyzed: de'i slob ma rnams kyis kyang ma he rdzi dang 'dra ba 'di dag ci shes zhes smras so //
translated: “What do these people who are like cowherds know?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: dge slong sde snod gsum pa gang yin pa de nyid ma he 'di yin no //
analyzed: dge slong sde snod gsum pa gang yin pa de nyid ma he 'di yin no //
translated: The one who was the tripiṭaka master then is now this buffalo.

original: slob ma de dag ni ma he rdzi 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: slob ma de dag ni ma he rdzi 'di dag yin te /
translated: His students then are now these cowherds.

original: las des na che rabs lnga brgyar ma her skyes so //
analyzed: las des na che rabs lnga brgyar ma her skyes so //
translated: Because of that karma, for five hundred lifetimes he was reborn as a buffalo.

original: slob ma rnams kyang ma he rdzi lnga brgyar gyur to //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyang ma he rdzi lnga brgyar gyur to //

analyzed: de'i steng du nyin gcig bzhin du lan bdun bdun bye tshan bab ste /

analyzed: de nas de 'di snyam du sems te /

translated: Then he will think, ‘I took up the eight-branched fasting observance, but I slackened in my training. Because of that, I am experiencing this suffering.

analyzed: bsrungs pa des ni rgyal srid thob par gyur to snyam mo //

analyzed: de'ang bdag gis bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad dang ldan par bsrung bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'o na tang bdag klu'i skye gnas las thar bar 'gyur yang srid do snyam mo //

analyzed: lha; bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa btsal du gsol /

translated: Then the king's attendants took out the pillar, and underneath it they found a golden scroll on which was written the eight branches of the Upavāsa, the five precepts of the lay ordination, and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: de nas rgyal pos klu de la bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa zhig bris te byin no //

analyzed: drang srong smra ba na gnas pa'i drang srong khri nyis stong gis kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun mngon sum du byas so //

original: dge slong dag /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Bhagavān had said this,

analyzed: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
translated: the bhikṣus rejoiced and praised what the Bhagavān had said.

analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /

analyzed: chom rkun dang / mu ge dang / nad rnams med pa dang / 'bras s'a lu dang / bu ram shing dang / pa lang dang / ma he dang ldan par 'dug ste /
translated: It was free from thieves and famine, and there was no disease. It was endowed with rice, sugarcane, cattle, and buffalo.

analyzed: gnod pa med cing tsher ma dkrugs la bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin du rgyal srid bskyangs so //
translated: He ruled the kingdom like a single son, without harm or disturbance, like a single son.

analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ba de'i tshe /

analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ngang pa de dag la mi 'jigs pa byin te /

analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal de nyid du btang nas /

translated: When the Blessed One was seated for the meal together with the great assembly of disciples, the geese went to the Blessed One.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos chen po de dag gis kyang de rnams khyos ma byin te /

analyzed: de dag gis zos nas tshim zhing mgu la dbang po rtas te 'khod do //

analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas 'khor bzhi po de dag la chos ston pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the Blessed One arose from his meditative composure and taught the Dharma to the fourfold assembly,

original: ngang pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi thang du dong ste /
analyzed: ngang pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi thang du dong ste /
translated: the geese went to the Blessed One's presence.

original: chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: chos nyan par byed do //

analyzed: de nas de dag tshe thung ste shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes so //

analyzed: lha'i bu'am lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems rnam pa gsum skye bar 'gyur te /

original: gang nas shi 'phos /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos /
translated: Where did they die?

original: gang du skyes /
analyzed: gang du skyes /
translated: Where were they reborn?

original: las gang gis skyes snyam mo //
analyzed: las gang gis skyes snyam mo //
translated: What karma caused them to be reborn there?”

original: de nas ngang pa las shi 'phos pa dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur pa de dag gis mthong ngo //

translated: Then they saw that they had died as geese and were reborn in the excellent god realm of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and that they had developed a loving attitude toward the Blessed One.

analyzed: de nas @254b sngon ngang par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: bdag cag zhag lon nas gzod bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag cag gi cha ma yin gyi /
translated: “It is not right for us to wait a day before going to see the Blessed One.

analyzed: bdag cag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: We should go to see the Blessed One right away.”

original: de nas sngon ngang par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub ko ra dag cing 'gul ba thogs pa /🔽lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
analyzed: de nas sngon ngang par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub ko ra dag cing 'gul ba thogs pa / lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
translated: Then the gods who had been geese, wearing earrings and anklets that jingled,🔽their bodies adorned with necklaces and bracelets,

original: nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i cod pan can /
translated: and their heads crowned with various precious jewels,

analyzed: lus gur kum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa de dag gis de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyi thu ba bkang ste /

analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /

original: chos nyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: and sat down in front of the Bhagavān to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ngang par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ngang par gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas /
