original: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / bsnyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / bsnyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
translated: and had obtained robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ser skya'i gnas na shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ser skya'i gnas na shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: He was dwelling in the Nyagrodha Park in Kapilavastu, together with the community of monks and the community of nuns.

original: de'i tshe ser skya'i gnas na sh'akya phyug cing nor @257b mang la longs spyod che ba yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe ser skya'i gnas na sh'akya phyug cing nor @257b mang la longs spyod che ba yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: At that time, in Kapilavastu, there lived a Śākya who was rich and had great wealth and many possessions, with vast and extensive holdings,

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des /
translated: who was as wealthy as Vaiśravaṇa and rivaled Vaiśravaṇa’s wealth.

original: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas; de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
analyzed: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas; de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal rank, and he enjoyed himself with her with love, fun, and delight.

original: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las chung ma la bu chags nas /🔽de zla ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las chung ma la bu chags nas / de zla ba brgyad dam /
translated: As he enjoyed himself with her with love, fun, and delight, his wife conceived a child.

original: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
analyzed: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
translated: After eight or nine months, a child was born.

original: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa mi'i kha dog las ni 'das /
analyzed: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa mi'i kha dog las ni 'das /
translated: The child was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful, with a complexion surpassing that of human beings

original: lha'i kha dog ni ma thob pa 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser gyi mdog 'dra ba zhig btsas te /
analyzed: lha'i kha dog ni ma thob pa 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser gyi mdog 'dra ba zhig btsas te /
translated: but not yet fully developed into the complexion of a god. He was born with the color of the gold of Jāmbū River.

original: de'i gser gyi 'od kyis grong khyer ser skya'i gnas thams cad snang bar byas so //
analyzed: de'i gser gyi 'od kyis grong khyer ser skya'i gnas thams cad snang bar byas so //
translated: The golden light of his body illuminated the entire city of Kapilavastu.

original: de nas pha ma dang / sems can gzhan dag gis de mthong nas ltad mo la lhags te /
analyzed: de nas pha ma dang / sems can gzhan dag gis de mthong nas ltad mo la lhags te /
translated: Then his parents and other sentient beings saw him and came to see the spectacle.

original: sems can gyi khyad par 'di lta bu ni ga las 'ongs zhig gu zhes mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur nas sems pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi khyad par 'di lta bu ni ga las 'ongs zhig gu zhes mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur nas sems pa la zhugs so //
translated: They were amazed and thought, “Where did such a special sentient being come from?”

original: de na de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: de na de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Then, after the birth celebration for his birth, they gave him a name, asking, “What name should we give this boy?”

original: nye du rnams na re /
analyzed: nye du rnams na re /
translated: His relatives said,

original: 'di btsas pa na grong khyer ser skya'i gnas thams cad gser gyi 'od kyis snang bar byas pas na /🔽de'i phyir khye'u 'di'i ming gser 'od ces gdags so zhes zer ro; ;de nas khye'u gser 'od bang na 'tsho ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / nu ma snun pa'i ma ma gnyis dang / dri ma 'khru ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / rtse ba'i ma ma gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di btsas pa na grong khyer ser skya'i gnas thams cad gser gyi 'od kyis snang bar byas pas na / de'i phyir khye'u 'di'i ming gser 'od ces gdags so zhes zer ro; ;de nas khye'u gser 'od bang na 'tsho ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / nu ma snun pa'i ma ma gnyis dang / dri ma 'khru ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / rtse ba'i ma ma gnyis te /
translated: “When he was born, the entire city of Kapilavastu was illuminated with golden light.🔽Therefore, let us name this boy Suvarṇaprabha.”

original: ma ma brgyad la gtad @258a *//
analyzed: ma ma brgyad la gtad @258a *//
translated: Then the boy Suvarṇaprabha was entrusted to eight nurses: two nurses to hold him in their laps, two nurses to suckle him, two nurses to bathe him, and two nurses to play with him.

original: nas; de ma ma brgyad kyis 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khu dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: nas; de ma ma brgyad kyis 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khu dang / gzhan yang /
translated: He was raised by eight nurses who nourished him with milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids,

original: yo byad kyi khyad par bzang ngo cog gis bskyed bsrings te /
analyzed: yo byad kyi khyad par bzang ngo cog gis bskyed bsrings te /
translated: and with other excellent and special substances.

original: mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
analyzed: mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
translated: He grew quickly like a lotus in a lake.

original: de'ang mkhas shing gsal la yid gzhungs pa dang / dad pa dang ldan la dge zhing bsam pa bzang ba dang / bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: de'ang mkhas shing gsal la yid gzhungs pa dang / dad pa dang ldan la dge zhing bsam pa bzang ba dang / bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa /
translated: He was also wise, clear-minded, and intelligent, had faith, was virtuous and good-natured, and was dedicated to benefiting himself and others.

original: snying rje can bdag nyid che ba chos 'dod pa zhig go /
analyzed: snying rje can bdag nyid che ba chos 'dod pa zhig go /
translated: He was compassionate, magnanimous, and longed for the Dharma.

original: phyis re zhig na de byad gzugs kyi rgyags pas myos te /
analyzed: phyis re zhig na de byad gzugs kyi rgyags pas myos te /
translated: Later, at one time, he became intoxicated with the arrogance of his physical beauty.

original: grong khyer gyi phyi rol na rtse zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi phyi rol na rtse zhing 'dug go /
translated: He was playing outside the city.

original: sh'akya mang po dag gcig kyang shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar dong ngo //
analyzed: sh'akya mang po dag gcig kyang shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar dong ngo //
translated: Many Śākyas went to the Nyagrodha Park.

original: de nas khye'u gser 'od kyis mthong nas dris pa /
analyzed: de nas khye'u gser 'od kyis mthong nas dris pa /
translated: Then the boy Suvarṇaprabha saw them and asked,

original: khyed gar 'dong /
analyzed: khyed gar 'dong /
translated: “Where are you going?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽“We are going to the Nyagrodha Park to see the Buddha.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar 'gro'o //
translated: I will go to the Nyagrodha Park to see the Blessed Buddha.

original: de nas khye'u gser 'od kyis sangs rgyas zhes bya ba thos te /
analyzed: de nas khye'u gser 'od kyis sangs rgyas zhes bya ba thos te /
translated: Then the boy Suvarṇaprabha heard the word “buddha.”

original: sngo ma thos pa'i ming thos nas spu thams cad zing zhes byas te /
analyzed: sngo ma thos pa'i ming thos nas spu thams cad zing zhes byas te /
translated: When he heard the name he had never heard before, his hairs stood on end.

original: mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He was filled with supreme wonder and thought,

original: ma la / bdag kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir 'gro gor ma chags snyam nas /
analyzed: ma la / bdag kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir 'gro gor ma chags snyam nas /
translated: “I too must go to see the Blessed Buddha.”

original: de'ang shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar song ba dang / khye'u gser 'od kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: de'ang shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar song ba dang / khye'u gser 'od kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: He went to the Nyagrodha Park, and there the boy Suvarṇaprabha saw the Blessed Buddha, his body well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: @258b dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: @258b dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
translated: beautified by the eighty minor marks,

original: 'od 'do ma gang gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'do ma gang gis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a fathom-wide halo,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
translated: with a radiance greater than a thousand suns,

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu'i kun nas bzang ba mthong nas /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu'i kun nas bzang ba mthong nas /
translated: Seeing the Blessed One, who was completely good like a mountain of jewels,

original: mthong ma thag tu byad gzugs kyi rgyags pa med par gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu byad gzugs kyi rgyags pa med par gyur te /
translated: she immediately lost her pride in her own beauty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas /
translated: She bowed down at the Blessed One’s feet

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: and sat before the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la chos bstan nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la chos bstan nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One taught her the Dharma.

original: de chos thos pa dang / rab tu 'byung bar 'dod par gyur to //
analyzed: de chos thos pa dang / rab tu 'byung bar 'dod par gyur to //
translated: When she heard the Dharma, she desired to go forth.

original: de nas re zhig na pha ma la gsol nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du song ste phyin nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na pha ma la gsol nas / bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du song ste phyin nas / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: After some time, she asked her parents🔽and went to the Blessed One.🔽When she arrived, she bowed her head at the Blessed One’s feet

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: and, bowing toward the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa /
translated: she said to the Blessed One, “Noble one,

original: bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung nas bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung nas bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: If I am allowed to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, complete my monastic training, and achieve the state of a fully ordained monk, then I too will practice pure conduct in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag gser gyi kha dog can glang po che'i sna ltar 'dug pa brkyang nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag gser gyi kha dog can glang po che'i sna ltar 'dug pa brkyang nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One extended his golden-colored arm, which was like the trunk of an elephant,

original: khye'u gser 'od la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: khye'u gser 'od la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: and said to the boy Suvarṇaprabha,

original: gzhon nu tshur shog /
analyzed: gzhon nu tshur shog /
translated: “Come, young man!

original: tshangs par spyod cig /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod cig /
translated: Practice pure conduct.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa'i mod la /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa'i mod la /
translated: As soon as he said this,

original: skra dang / kha spu bregs nas zhag bdun lon pa tsam du gyur /🔽spyod lam ni bsnyen par @259a *//
analyzed: skra dang / kha spu bregs nas zhag bdun lon pa tsam du gyur / spyod lam ni bsnyen par @259a *//
translated: the boy’s hair and beard were shaved, and he was dressed in monastic robes.

original: rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa lta bur 'dug par gyur /
analyzed: rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa lta bur 'dug par gyur /
translated: He looked as if he had been a monk for a hundred years.

original: lag na ni lhung bzed dang / chu snod thogs par gyur te //
analyzed: lag na ni lhung bzed dang / chu snod thogs par gyur te //
translated: He held a begging bowl and a water jar in his hands.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas tshur  zhes bka' stsal pas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas tshur  zhes bka' stsal pas //
translated: The Thus-Gone One said, “Come!”

original: de ni mgo bregs lus la snam sbyar gyon //
analyzed: de ni mgo bregs lus la snam sbyar gyon //
translated: He shaved his head and face, put on the outer and inner robes,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni dgongs pas go bgos nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni dgongs pas go bgos nas //
translated: and was clothed in the thought of the Buddha.

original: mod la dbang po rab tu zhi bar gnas //
analyzed: mod la dbang po rab tu zhi bar gnas //
translated: Immediately his faculties became calm and peaceful.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas /
translated: Then he sat in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la yid la byed pa'i lung phog ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la yid la byed pa'i lung phog ste /
translated: and the Blessed One gave him instructions on how to focus his mind.

original: des brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas /
analyzed: des brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas /
translated: Through diligence, practice, and effort, he understood that this very five-part cycle of existence is unstable and unsteady,

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad snyil ba dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad snyil ba dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /
translated: and he resolved that all conditioned things are subject to decay, falling, disintegration, and destruction.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas /
translated: He abandoned all afflictive emotions

original: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: and manifested arhatship.

original: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
translated: As an arhat, free from the attachments of the three realms,

original: gser dang / bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: gser dang / bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: he was indifferent to gold and manure.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: His mind was like the sky and the palm of his hand.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /🔽rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa / rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: He was as cool as sandalwood.🔽He had broken the shell of ignorance with knowledge.

original: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: He had attained knowledge, insight, and self-confidence.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur sti la mi lta bar /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur sti la mi lta bar /
translated: He was not concerned with the gains, desires, and respect of this world.

original: dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra @259b ba'i gnas su gyur to //🔽de nas dge slong dag the tshom skyes te /
analyzed: dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra @259b ba'i gnas su gyur to // de nas dge slong dag the tshom skyes te /
translated: He was an object of offering, worship, and reverential salutation by the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: Then the monks, feeling doubtful, inquired of the Buddha, the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the one who had put an end to all doubts and uncertainties,

original: btsun pa / gser 'od kyis las gang dag bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / gser 'od kyis las gang dag bgyis na /
translated: “Reverend, what actions did Suvarṇaprabha take

original: des 'di ltar gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa dang / rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
analyzed: des 'di ltar gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa dang / rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
translated: that he was so handsome, good-looking, and pleasant to behold, and that after going forth he manifested arhatship?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: gser 'od nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: gser 'od nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
translated: Suvarṇa-prabhāsa himself, in other lives, acquired the accumulations and possessed the conditions

original: dba' rgal bzhin du 'byung la /
analyzed: dba' rgal bzhin du 'byung la /
translated: and they will come to him like a flood.

original: gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las de dag byas shing bsags pas na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las de dag byas shing bsags pas na /
translated: There is no doubt that he will experience the results of the actions he has committed and accumulated.

original: gser 'od nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gser 'od nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Suvarṇa-prabhāsa himself committed and accumulated those actions. Who else will experience their results?

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
translated: the actions that he has committed and accumulated will not ripen on the external earth element.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not ripen on the water element, the fire element, or the wind element.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that he has committed and accumulated will ripen exclusively on the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that he has appropriated.”

original: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: do not perish even in a hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the conditions are assembled and the time comes,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: they will ripen into their own fruit.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /🔽bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa la de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na / bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa la de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: in the past, ninety-one eons ago,

original: dgra bcom pa; yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /🔽rig pa @260a *//
analyzed: dgra bcom pa; yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas / rig pa @260a *//
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: dang; zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: dang; zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: the one with knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Well-Gone One,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: the Knower of the World,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the unsurpassable guide who tames beings,

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: the Teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: the Blessed Buddha Vipaśyin appeared in the world.

original: de rgyal po'i pho brang gnyen ldan na rten cing bzhugs pa las /
analyzed: de rgyal po'i pho brang gnyen ldan na rten cing bzhugs pa las /
translated: He resided in the royal capital Bandhumatī.

original: re zhig na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs /
analyzed: re zhig na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs /
translated: At one time, the Perfectly Awakened Vipaśyin,

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad nas /
translated: having accomplished all the activities of a Buddha,

original: shing zad pa'i me bzhin du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: shing zad pa'i me bzhin du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: He passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without the remainder of the skandhas, like a fire when there is no more wood.

original: de nas rgyal po gnyen 'od kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gdung la sku gdung gi mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gnyen 'od kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gdung la sku gdung gi mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Then King Bandhumat made offerings to the relics of the Blessed One.

original: rin po che sna bzhi las byas pa'i mchod rten kho ra khor yug tu dpag tshad gcig yod la /
analyzed: rin po che sna bzhi las byas pa'i mchod rten kho ra khor yug tu dpag tshad gcig yod la /
translated: He built a stūpa made of the four precious substances, one yojana in circumference,

original: 'phang du rgyang grags gcig yod pa zhig brtsigs te /
analyzed: 'phang du rgyang grags gcig yod pa zhig brtsigs te /
translated: and one krośa in height.

original: mchod rten gyi dus ston yang lugs btod do //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi dus ston yang lugs btod do //
translated: He also established a festival for the stūpa.

original: de nas re zhig na khyim bdag gcig mchod rten gyi dus ston byed pa der song ba las mchod rten de las gser gyi me long zhig lhung ba des mthong nas des de'i rna ba'i gong rgyan du bcos nas mchod rten de la btags te /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na khyim bdag gcig mchod rten gyi dus ston byed pa der song ba las mchod rten de las gser gyi me long zhig lhung ba des mthong nas des de'i rna ba'i gong rgyan du bcos nas mchod rten de la btags te /
translated: Then one day a householder went to the festival for the stūpa. He saw a golden mirror that had fallen from the stūpa. He put it on the top of his ear ornament and attached it to the stūpa.

original: spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog gis mchod nas zhabs la phyag btsal te smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog gis mchod nas zhabs la phyag btsal te smon lam btab pa /
translated: He made offerings of incense, perfume, and flowers, bowed down at the feet of the Buddha, and made this aspiration:

original: bdag gis kyang yon tan 'di lta bu dag thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang yon tan 'di lta bu dag thob par gyur cig /
translated: “May I also obtain such qualities.

original: ston pa 'di lta bu mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: ston pa 'di lta bu mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: May I please such a teacher.

original: mi mnyes @260b pa byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: mi mnyes @260b pa byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: May I not displease him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na khyim bdag tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni khye'u gser 'od 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na khyim bdag tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni khye'u gser 'od 'di yin te /
translated: The one who was the householder then is now the boy Suvarṇaprabha.

original: des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs kyi mchod rten la bkur sti byas pa des na 'di lta bur byad gzugs kyi khyad par can du gyur to //
analyzed: des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs kyi mchod rten la bkur sti byas pa des na 'di lta bur byad gzugs kyi khyad par can du gyur to //
translated: Because he venerated the stūpa of the Completely Awakened One Vipaśyin, he became one with such distinctive physical beauty.

original: smon lam btab pa des ni tshe 'di la dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa des ni tshe 'di la dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Because he made the aspiration, in this life he manifested arhatship.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: de ltar na las gcig tu nges par gang pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par gang par 'gyur ro //🔽las gcig tu nges par dkar ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par dkar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na las gcig tu nges par gang pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par gang par 'gyur ro // las gcig tu nges par dkar ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par dkar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, those actions that are definitely black will have a definitely black ripening.🔽Those actions that are definitely white will have a definitely white ripening.

original: las 'dren ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang 'dren mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dren ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang 'dren mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those actions that are mixed will have a mixed ripening.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: de bas na las gcig tu nges par gang pa rnams dang / las 'dren ma spangs la /
analyzed: de bas na las gcig tu nges par gang pa rnams dang / las 'dren ma spangs la /
translated: therefore, abandon those actions that are definitely black and those that are mixed.

original: las gcig tu nges par dkar ba rnams 'ba' zhig la gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: las gcig tu nges par dkar ba rnams 'ba' zhig la gtad par bya ste /
translated: You should only engage in those actions that are definitely white.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken these words,

original: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
analyzed: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
translated: the monks rejoiced and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: dri zhim zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dri zhim zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Story of Gandhamadana🔽Thus have I heard.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon @261a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon @261a *//
translated: merchants,

original: rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /
analyzed: rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /
translated: gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas.

original: bla mar byas /🔽ri mor byas /
analyzed: bla mar byas / ri mor byas /
translated: He was venerated,

original: mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: mchod pa byas te /
translated: worshipped,🔽and made offerings to by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, who was worshipped and known by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas, was endowed with great merit,

original: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
translated: He had obtained robes, alms-food, bedding, a seat, and medicines for the sick,

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yul ser skya'i gnas na shing n+ya gro dha'i kun ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yul ser skya'i gnas na shing n+ya gro dha'i kun ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: and he was staying in the Nyagrodha Park in Kapilavastu with the community of monks and the community of nuns.

original: de'i tshe ser skya'i gnas na khyim bdag phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba; yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe ser skya'i gnas na khyim bdag phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba; yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: At that time, in Kapilavastu, there lived a certain householder who was rich, with great wealth and property, vast and extensive holdings, and riches to rival Vaiśravaṇa.

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal status,

original: de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
analyzed: de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
translated: and he enjoyed himself with her with the five kinds of sensual pleasures.

original: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las chung ma la bu chags nas /🔽de zla ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las chung ma la bu chags nas / de zla ba brgyad dam /
translated: While he was enjoying himself with her with the five kinds of sensual pleasures, his wife conceived a child.🔽After eight or nine months,

original: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
analyzed: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
translated: she gave birth to a child.

original: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig mi'i kha dog las ni 'das /
analyzed: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig mi'i kha dog las ni 'das /
translated: He had surpassed the complexion of a human,

original: lha'i kha dog ni ma thob pa zhig btsas te /
analyzed: lha'i kha dog ni ma thob pa zhig btsas te /
translated: but had not yet attained the complexion of a god.

original: de'i kha nas me tog autpa la'i dri 'byung ba lus thams cad nas @261b ni tsandan gyi dri byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i kha nas me tog autpa la'i dri 'byung ba lus thams cad nas @261b ni tsandan gyi dri byung ngo //
translated: The fragrance of blue lotuses came from his mouth, and the scent of sandalwood arose from his entire body.

original: de nas de'i btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas /
translated: When he was born, they held a feast for his birth.

original: khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: “What name should we give this child?”

original: de'i nye du rnams na re /
analyzed: de'i nye du rnams na re /
translated: His relatives said,

original: 'di'i kha nas autpa la'i dri byung la; lus thams cad nas tsandan gyi dri byung bas na /
analyzed: 'di'i kha nas autpa la'i dri byung la; lus thams cad nas tsandan gyi dri byung bas na /
translated: “Since the fragrance of blue lotuses comes from his mouth, and the scent of sandalwood arises from his entire body,

original: de'i phyir khye'u 'di'i ming dri zhim zhes gdags so zhes zer ro //🔽de nas khye'u dri zhim pang na 'tsho ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / nu ma snun pa'i ma ma gnyis dang / dri ma 'khru ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / rtse ba'i ma ma gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khye'u 'di'i ming dri zhim zhes gdags so zhes zer ro // de nas khye'u dri zhim pang na 'tsho ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / nu ma snun pa'i ma ma gnyis dang / dri ma 'khru ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / rtse ba'i ma ma gnyis te /
translated: let us name this child Gandhahastin.”

original: ma ma brgyad la gtad nas /
analyzed: ma ma brgyad la gtad nas /
translated: Then the child Gandhahastin was entrusted to eight nurses—two nurses to hold him in their laps, two wet nurses, two massage nurses, and two playmates.

original: de ma ma brgyad kyi sa'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khu dang; gzhan yang yo byad kyi khyad par bzang ngo cog gis bskyed bsrings te /
analyzed: de ma ma brgyad kyi sa'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khu dang; gzhan yang yo byad kyi khyad par bzang ngo cog gis bskyed bsrings te /
translated: He was raised by eight nurses, with milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and with all kinds of other excellent substances.

original: mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
analyzed: mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
translated: He grew quickly like a lotus in a lake.

original: de'ang sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs kyi shugs kyis dad pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: de'ang sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs kyi shugs kyis dad pa dang ldan la /
translated: Moreover, by the power of his previous causes, he was endowed with faith.

original: dge zhing bsam pa bzang la /
analyzed: dge zhing bsam pa bzang la /
translated: He was virtuous, had a good heart,

original: bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa /
translated: and was engaged in benefiting himself and others.

original: snying rje can bdag nyid che la chos 'dod pa zhig ste /
analyzed: snying rje can bdag nyid che la chos 'dod pa zhig ste /
translated: He was compassionate, magnanimous, and longed for the Dharma.

original: gang gi tshe khye'u dri zhim dpung rgyan dang / mgul ba'i do shal dang; gdu bus brgyan te srang gi nang du zhugs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khye'u dri zhim dpung rgyan dang / mgul ba'i do shal dang; gdu bus brgyan te srang gi nang du zhugs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the boy Gandhahastin was adorned with armlets, necklaces, and bracelets and entered the marketplace,

original: tsandan gyi dri bsung gis grong khyer thams cad khyab par gyur ste /
analyzed: tsandan gyi dri bsung gis grong khyer thams cad khyab par gyur ste /
translated: the fragrance of sandalwood pervaded the entire city.

original: skye bo mang pos kyang lha'i spos kyi dri tshor nas mchog tu ya mtshan du 'dzin te /
analyzed: skye bo mang pos kyang lha'i spos kyi dri tshor nas mchog tu ya mtshan du 'dzin te /
translated: Many people, having smelled the fragrance of divine incense, were amazed.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: He said:

original: kye ma; bsod nams dag gi mthu zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: kye ma; bsod nams dag gi mthu zhes 'dzer to //
translated: “Oh! The power of merit!”

original: phyis re zhig na khye'u dri zhim shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar song ngo //
analyzed: phyis re zhig na khye'u dri zhim shing n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar song ngo //
translated: Later, the boy Gandhahastin went to the Nyagrodha Park.

original: de nas des sangs rgyas bcom @262a *//
analyzed: de nas des sangs rgyas bcom @262a *//
translated: There he saw the Buddha, the Blessed One,

original: ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: whose body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
translated: embellished with the eighty minor marks,

original: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a fathom-wide halo,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
translated: with a radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang ba mthong nas /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang ba mthong nas /
translated: beautiful in every way, like a moving jeweled mountain.

original: mthong ma thag tu des bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' ba bskyed do //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu des bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' ba bskyed do //
translated: As soon as he saw him, he gave rise to joy towards the Blessed One.

original: dga' ba bskyed nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: Having given rise to joy, he touched his head to the Blessed One’s feet

original: chos nyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: and sat before the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang; bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang; bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing his thoughts, inclinations,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
translated: nature, and disposition, gave him a discourse on the Dharma that penetrated the four noble truths.
